name: Time Stamp
description: The TS data type represents a timestamp with two components: the time of an event and the degree of precision. It combines date and time information to specify when an event occurred, with flexible precision from year-only to fractional seconds.

TS.1.name: Time of an Event
TS.1.description: The actual timestamp value in YYYYMMDD[HHMM[SS[.SSSS]]][+/-ZZZZ] format. The precision is determined by the number of characters included.

TS.2.name: Degree of Precision
TS.2.description: Indicates the precision of the timestamp (Y=year, L=month, D=day, H=hour, M=minute, S=second). Optional component for explicit precision specification.

constraints.precision: Precision determined by the number of digits included
constraints.timezone: Time zone offset in +/-HHMM format when specified
constraints.fractional: Fractional seconds (.SSSS) allowed for sub-second precision

usage: Message timestamp in MSH.7 - Date/Time of Message
Event timestamps in EVN.2 - Recorded Date/Time
Patient birth date/time in PID.7 - Date/Time of Birth
Observation timestamps in OBX.14 - Date/Time of the Observation
Any date/time field requiring precise timing

generationHints.typical: Use current or recent timestamps for realistic healthcare scenarios
generationHints.format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS is the most common precision level
generationHints.timezone: Include timezone offset for systems spanning multiple time zones
generationHints.precision: Match precision to the clinical context (birth dates vs observation times)

validationRules.dateFormat: Must follow YYYYMMDD format for date portion
validationRules.timeFormat: Must follow HHMMSS format for time portion when included
validationRules.ranges: All date/time components must be within valid ranges
